p: Arboviruses have over time gained a unique standing among viruses due to their biological transmission mode involving the virus, vector and vertebrates beside other abiotic and biotic factors. Understanding the nature, extent and impact of population immunity in emerging Zika epidemics and other arbovirus fetal, childhood and maternal burden is vital in elucidating the contextual knowledge and practices on co-infections. Our finding showed that very little is documented in the sero-surveillance and molecular profiling of ZIKV among varied endemic or epidemic prone-settings in Africa with much insight information originating from Europe, Asia and America ( Table 2a).
